/notes/bms.note1: This is the battery management system (BMS) manager config file for Risen
/notes/bms.note1a: /assets/bms/summary        - defines the web UI for the BMS. BMS-related statuses, controls, and faults/alarms are displayed on the UI
/notes/bms.note1b: /config/bms                - defines configurable variables used in the ESS Controller source code
/notes/bms.note1d: /status/bms                - defines the status variables for the BMS
/notes/bms.note1e: /components/[id]           - defines the interface for retrieving data from the BMS hardware and converting the data into a useable format (ex.: scaling, remap, etc.)
/notes/bms.note1f: /links/bms                 - defines mapping of external interface components to internal variables
/notes/bms.note1g: /vlinks/bms                - allows two variables to share the same value
/notes/bms.note1h: /sched/bms                 - defines the variables that will run a function on a scheduled basis
/notes/bms.note1i: /schedule/wake_monitor/bms - periodically runs a function for a particular variable (default to 100ms; wake_monitor to be removed)
/notes/bms.note1j: /faults/bms                - defines BMS-related faults reported by the ESS Controller (will trigger PCS shutdown)
/notes/bms.note1k: /alarms/bms                - defines BMS-related alarms reported by the ESS Controller
/notes/bms.note1l: /sets/blocked              - blocks fims set for a particular uri
/notes/bms.note1m: /templates/bms             - defines the asset instances (ex.: battery racks) managed by the BMS manager
/notes/bms.note2: To retrieve data from the BMS hardware, the modbus communication protocol will be used. To connect via modbus, use the modbus client (bms_modbus_client.json)

remap.note: Send close contactors command to BMS
Send open contactors command to BMS

CloseContactors.note: Close DC contactors command to send to BMS if the BMS is off ready (meaning DC contactors are open) and the PCS is either off or faulted [TODO: add additional conditions here, if needed]

OpenContactors.note: Open DC contactors command to send to BMS if the BMS is on ready (meaning DC contactors are closed) [TODO: add additional conditions here, if needed]

VerifyContactorsClosed.note: Verify that the BMS system state is now on ready (meaning DC contactors are closed) when the close contactors command is sent

VerifyContactorsOpened.note: Verify that the BMS system state is now off ready (meaning DC contactors are open) when the open contactors command is sent

remap.note: Send 0 kW command to PCS before proceeding to shutdown
Send 0 kVAr command to PCS before proceeding to shutdown
Send stop command to PCS after verifying 0 kW and 0 kVAr is set to PCS

CloseContactorsSuccess.note: Validation variable is set if the command value in /controls/bms:CloseContactors is successfully/unsuccessfully set

remap.outValue: Failed to send/verify close contactors command (1) to BMS

OpenContactorsSuccess.note: Validation variable is set if the command value in /controls/bms:OpenContactors is successfully/unsuccessfully set

remap.outValue: Failed to send/verify open contactors command (2) to BMS

VerifyContactorsClosedSuccess.note: If the BMS failed to close contactors after an elasped time, send an alarm

remap.outValue: Failed to close contactors for BMS

VerifyContactorsOpenedSuccess.note: If the BMS failed to open contactors after an elasped time, send an alarm

remap.outValue: Failed to open contactors for BMS

bau_alarm_state.note6: Bit4: Rack vol diff over large warning
bau_alarm_state.note7: Bit5: Racks current diff over large warning

/faults/bms.note: Leave as is for now. This definition is needed for clear faults UI cmd to work
